courses.description: JSS1 Mathematics course covering whole numbers, fractions, algebra, and geometry.

lessons.description: Counting, writing, and place value of whole numbers.
lessons.textContent: This lesson introduces whole numbers, including how to count, write, and determine the place value of digits in large numbers.

lessons.description: Introduction to fractions, decimals, and percentages.
lessons.textContent: This lesson provides an introduction to fractions, decimals, and percentages, and how to convert between them.

lessons.description: Using symbols, identifying coefficients, and simplifying like terms.
lessons.textContent: This lesson introduces basic algebraic concepts, such as using symbols to represent numbers, identifying coefficients, and simplifying algebraic expressions by collecting like terms.

lessons.description: Perimeter and area of regular and irregular shapes.
lessons.textContent: This lesson covers plane shapes, including how to calculate the perimeter and area of regular and irregular shapes like squares, rectangles, and triangles.

lessons.description: Introduction to statistics and calculating mean, median, and mode.
lessons.textContent: This lesson provides an introduction to statistics, including how to calculate the mean, median, and mode of a set of data.

questions.questionText: What is the place value of the digit 5 in the number 25,834?
What is the perimeter of a square with a side length of 5cm?

courses.description: JSS1 English Language course focusing on speech, grammar, reading, and writing.

lessons.description: Introduction to the organs of speech.
lessons.textContent: This lesson introduces the organs of speech and their functions in producing sounds.

lessons.description: Introduction to the eight parts of speech.
lessons.textContent: This lesson provides an introduction to the eight parts of speech: nouns, pronouns, verbs, adjectives, adverbs, prepositions, conjunctions, and interjections.

lessons.lessonTitle: Reading and Comprehension: Identifying Main Ideas
lessons.description: Strategies for identifying main and supporting ideas in a passage.
lessons.textContent: This lesson teaches strategies for identifying the main and supporting ideas in a reading passage.

lessons.description: Learning the format and style of informal letters.
lessons.textContent: This lesson introduces the format and style of informal letter writing, for communicating with friends and family.

lessons.description: Definition and features of literature, including African folktales.
lessons.textContent: This lesson provides an introduction to literature, including its definition and features, with a focus on African folktales.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is NOT an organ of speech?
Which part of speech is the word 'beautiful'?
What is the main purpose of an informal letter?
options: To communicate with friends and family
questions.correctAnswer: To communicate with friends and family

courses.description: JSS1 Basic Science covering living and non-living things, human development, and energy.

lessons.description: Classification and characteristics of living and non-living things.
lessons.textContent: This lesson covers the classification and characteristics of living and non-living things.

lessons.description: Understanding sanitation and refuse and sewage management.
lessons.textContent: This lesson focuses on human development, with a focus on sanitation and the management of refuse and sewage.

lessons.description: Understanding the classes of food and the importance of a balanced diet.
lessons.textContent: This lesson introduces the different classes of food and explains the importance of a balanced diet for human health.

lessons.description: Meaning, sources, and forms of energy.
lessons.textContent: This lesson introduces the concept of energy, its various sources (renewable and non-renewable), and its different forms.

lessons.description: Meaning, types, and uses of forces.
lessons.textContent: This lesson introduces the concept of forces, including their meaning, different types (e.g., gravitational, frictional), and their uses.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a characteristic of living things?
Which of the following is a class of food?
Which of the following is a renewable source of energy?

courses.description: JSS1 Social Studies covering culture, socialization, family, and safety.

lessons.description: Definition, types, and components of culture.
lessons.textContent: This lesson introduces the concept of culture, including its definition, different types, and various components.

lessons.description: Definition, types, and agents of socialization.
lessons.textContent: This lesson defines socialization and discusses its different types and the various agents of socialization, such as the family, school, and peers.

lessons.description: The family as a primary social group, its types, roles, and functions.
lessons.textContent: This lesson discusses the family as a primary social group, its different types, and the roles and responsibilities of its members.

lessons.description: Causes, effects, and solutions to social problems like cultism and examination malpractices.
lessons.textContent: This lesson explores contemporary social problems in Nigeria, such as cultism and examination malpractices, discussing their causes, effects, and potential solutions.

lessons.description: The importance of safety and safety measures in the home and environment.
lessons.textContent: This lesson emphasizes the importance of safety and discusses various safety measures that should be taken in the home and the wider environment.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is an agent of socialization?
A family made up of a man, his wife, and their children is called...
Which of the following is a social problem in Nigeria?
